intro: Lychnis alba subsp. divaricata, commonly known as white campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in racemes, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils.
